meanings.sent1: He bazzed the ball with all his might.
meanings.sent2: She bazzed the door closed in anger.
meanings.sent3: The cat bazzed the mouse away with a swift paw.
meanings.sent4: The storm bazzed the trees, causing them to sway violently.
meanings.sent5: The hammer bazzed the nail into the wood effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To be under the influence of drugs or alcohol.
meanings.sent1: After a few drinks, he was completely bazzed.
meanings.sent2: She regretted getting bazzed at the party last night.
meanings.sent3: The movie character acted funny because he was bazzed.
meanings.sent4: The colors seemed brighter when she was bazzed.
meanings.sent5: He felt dizzy and disoriented when he was bazzed.

meanings.definition: To be extremely excited or enthusiastic.
meanings.sent1: The kids were bazzed about going to the amusement park.
meanings.sent2: She was bazzed to receive the award for her hard work.
meanings.sent3: His face lit up, bazzed with joy when he saw the surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her heart bazzed with anticipation before the big announcement.
meanings.sent5: The crowd bazzed with energy as the band took the stage.
